summary: Written on the blank recto of the first leaf of a manuscript containing a number of s. xii Latin texts, including the Vita S. Alexis and Bede, Historia Ecclesiastica. The first note names the sons of Lothbrok, including Ubba and Beorn, in English, and is followed by a Latin note on the deeds of Ubba and Beorn. The second note describes the location of Kenelm’s head. Alongside it, in the margin, is a Latin note of s. xiii, giving the author as John de Cella, abbot 1195-1214, and repeating the English note in Latin. Ker 1957 notes that the English and Latin texts on this folio are all in the same hand, and that ‘the manuscript belonged almost certainly to the cell of St. Albans at Tynemouth’ (p. 124).

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1r) Ynguar. And Ubbe. Beorn wæs þe þridde. Loþebrokes suns. loþe weren criste

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: (fol. 1v) In clench qu becche under ane þorne. Liet kenelm kinebern heued bereued

admin: Described by Mary Swan and Owen Roberson with the assistance of Sanne Van Der Schee, with reference to published scholarship; ed. by Takako Kato (2010; 2013).
